page.title: 11Stutton Primary School.
page.content: Stutton primary school was first built in 1835.The Reverend Thomas mills held a bazaar to raise the money.The village then had a population of four hundred people but nearly 200 pounds was raised ! In 1849 a new school was built on land adjacent to the original building.This was larger and had more plaground space.The building had room for 120 pupils. In 1964 during a long hot,dry summer the school was burnt down.The children were then educated at neighbouring schools until 1965 when a new building was opend on the same site. There are now 60 children aged from 5-11 years at the school.The school is an important part of the village due to close links between home and school.
